Solitude, celestial maid,</br>Once again to thee I bow,</br>And beneath the beechen shade</br>Pour to thee my ardent vow.
Mingled with the worldly crowd,</br>Thee my heart has still ador'd;</br>Nor could Pleasure's revels loud</br>E'er to me one joy afford.
Come then, with that form divine,</br>Such as in Ierne's isle,</br>While I heap'd thy rustic shrine,</br>Oft you deign'd on me to smile.
Come with modest, easy mien,</br>Unconstrain'd by modish art,</br>Blooming cheek, and eye serene,</br>Tranquil mind, and spotless heart.
Spread new verdure o'er the plain,</br>Add fresh odours to the breeze;</br>Crown the feather'd songster's strain</br>With unwonted melodies.
Lead me thro' yon waving grove,</br>Where the thicket boughs unite;</br>'Mid its mazes let me rove,</br>Wrapt with thee from mortal sight.
And from thy sequester'd cell</br>Bring the sober train along,</br>Who delight with thee to dwell,</br>Shelter'd from the guilty throng:
Meditation, pensive fair,</br>Deep immers'd in thought profound;</br>Leisure with unruffled air,</br>Pacing careless o'er the ground:
Active Health and ruddy face,</br>Bounding thro' the woodlands wild;</br>Beauty with unstudied grace;</br>Temperance with carriage mild.
Happy they who ne'er have flown</br>From thy pure and gentle reign;</br>Happier who, life's quicksands known,</br>Rush to Peace and thee again.
For them sweeter seems the rose,</br>Clearer flows for them the stream;</br>Richer tints the groves disclose,</br>Brighter shines the morning beam.
From each vain delusion freed,</br>Passion's helpless slaves no more,</br>They, while fairer views succeed,</br>Smiling think on dangers o'er.
Thus the slumberer wrapt in night</br>Pines 'mid visions of distress—</br>But with the returning light</br>Wakes to real happiness.</br>
